result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Max P. Wucherpfennig #581231

defendant.name: Wucherpfennig #581231, Max P.
defendant.address: Jackson Correctional Institution, PO BOX 232, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.  Set for plea/sentencing.  JA to contact Jackson Correctional to confirm date and time include New Lisbon correctional for victim notification.

1:28 PM Attorney Carly June Sebion appeared by video for Max P. Wucherpfennig,  #581231 in custody from Jackson Correctional.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he/she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Probable cause found.

Waiver of Prelim on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:07 AM Defendant Max P. Wucherpfennig #581231 appeared by video, in custody, from Jackson Correctional Facility.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will contact SPD.  AIA set for 7/11 at 4:15 pm. JA to reach out to JCI. Defendant stated he will probably not sign the bond. Court ordered the defendant to not have contact w/Victim 1
